slides.title: Set-Theoretic Information Retrieval
slides.subtitle: Fuzzy Sets and Extended Boolean Models

content.text: Extending the rigid logic of the Boolean model to handle the ambiguity of natural language using Fuzzy Logic.
content.hook: Is a tomato a fruit? In Boolean logic, yes/no. In Fuzzy logic, it's 0.8 Fruit, 0.4 Vegetable.

content.text: Standard Boolean (AND/OR) has no notion of 'partial match'. If a document has 4 out of 5 query terms, Boolean AND rejects it completely. We need a way to 'soften' these operators.

content.definition: Fuzzy Set Theory: An element belongs to a set with a degree of membership between 0 and 1, rather than just 0 or 1.
content.text: In IR, a term characterizes a document with a certain degree (e.g., correlation factor). We use fuzzy operations (Min/Max) instead of logical AND/OR.

formula.description: Fuzzy set operations extend classical Boolean logic to handle partial membership with degrees between 0 and 1.

terms.meaning: Membership degree of element x in fuzzy set A - value between 0 and 1
Fuzzy AND (Intersection) - minimum of the two membership degrees
Takes the smaller membership value - implements strict AND logic
Fuzzy OR (Union) - maximum of the two membership degrees
Takes the larger membership value - implements generous OR logic
Fuzzy NOT (Complement) - inverts the membership degree
Subtracts from 1 - if highly member (0.9), becomes low non-member (0.1)

content.text: Proposed by Salton et al. to bridge Boolean and Vector Space models. It introduces the 'p-norm' concept to control the strictness of AND/OR.
content.hook: It allows a query like 'A AND B' to act like 'Vector A + Vector B' (soft) or 'A intersect B' (strict) depending on parameter P.

content.text:
P = 1: Behaves like Vector Space (Sum).
P = Infinity: Behaves like Standard Boolean (Min/Max).
This allows tuning the system for precision vs recall.

slides.title: Concept Check
questions: What is the range of a fuzzy membership function?
If A=0.7 and B=0.3, what is Fuzzy AND(A, B)?
How does the Extended Boolean model solve the 'all-or-nothing' problem?
What is a Thesaurus in the context of Fuzzy IR used for?
answers: The range is [0, 1], where 0 means non-membership and 1 means full membership.
Fuzzy AND uses the MIN function, so min(0.7, 0.3) = 0.3.
It uses the P-norm concept to soften operators, allowing a query like 'A AND B' to behave partially like a vector sum, controlling strictness via parameter P.
It is used to define associative relationships (synonyms) with degrees of similarity (e.g., 'auto' is 0.9 similar to 'car'), expanding queries fuzzily.
